text: I have little interest or pleasure in doing things.
interpretation_guidance: Higher scores suggest diminished interest and potential depression.
notes: Consider follow-up if multiple mood items score high.

text: I feel down, depressed, or hopeless.
interpretation_guidance: High scores may indicate clinical depression.

text: I feel tired or have little energy.
interpretation_guidance: Fatigue is a common symptom of depression.

text: I have trouble falling or staying asleep, or I sleep too much.
interpretation_guidance: Sleep disturbances often relate to depression severity.

text: I feel nervous, anxious, or on edge.
interpretation_guidance: Elevated anxiety levels are signaled by strong agreement.

text: I worry too much about different things.
interpretation_guidance: Persistent worry is a key indicator of generalized anxiety.

text: I have difficulty controlling my worrying.
interpretation_guidance: Difficulty managing worries may increase anxiety risk.

text: I have become easily annoyed or irritable.
interpretation_guidance: Irritability can be associated with both mood and anxiety disorders.

text: I feel restless or find it hard to sit still.
interpretation_guidance: Restlessness is a common physiological sign of anxiety.

text: I experience unwanted, intrusive thoughts.
interpretation_guidance: Intrusive thoughts are typical in OCD presentations.

text: I perform certain actions or rituals repeatedly to ease my anxiety.
interpretation_guidance: Repetitive behaviors can be compulsions aimed at reducing anxiety.

text: I often feel that I must check things repeatedly (e.g., locks, switches, appliances).
interpretation_guidance: Excessive checking is a common compulsion in OCD.

text: I have difficulty concentrating on tasks.
interpretation_guidance: Poor concentration can be linked to both depression and anxiety.
research_reference: Kroenke et al. (2001); Spitzer et al. (2006)

text: I feel that everything is an effort.
interpretation_guidance: This can indicate low energy or motivation often found in depression.

text: I feel overwhelmed by my daily responsibilities.
interpretation_guidance: Feeling overwhelmed is a notable sign of anxiety.

text: I experience sudden feelings of panic or fear without an obvious reason.
interpretation_guidance: Panic episodes can be an important indicator of severe anxiety.

text: I often feel that I am not good enough.
interpretation_guidance: Feelings of worthlessness are core symptoms of depression.

text: I frequently find myself doubting my decisions or abilities.
interpretation_guidance: Self-doubt may contribute to both anxiety and obsessive behaviors.

text: I worry that I may hurt myself or others.
interpretation_guidance: Any indication of self-harm or harm to others requires prompt clinical evaluation.
notes: Ensure immediate help is advised if scores are high.

text: I find it difficult to trust my own judgment.
interpretation_guidance: Difficulty trusting oneself can be linked with heightened anxiety.
